message.content:
cs.CR, cs.GT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NI

This paper deals with the problem of incentive compatibility in a blockchain system, specifically Algorand. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as it involves designing a reward system that incentivizes honest behavior and discourages malicious behavior. The paper also uses game theory (cs.GT) to model the strategic interactions between nodes in the network. Additionally, the paper discusses the scalability of the Algorand protocol (cs.DC) and the efficiency of its consensus mechanism (cs.DS). Finally, the paper touches upon the networking aspects of the system (cs.NI) as it considers the behavior of nodes in a distributed network.
